title: 1928 New Zealand rugby league season
text:
The 1928 New Zealand rugby league season was the 21st season of <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> that had been played in New Zealand.
International competitions.
<a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> lost a series against <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, 1-2. New Zealand were coached by <a href="Thomas%20McClymont">Thomas McClymont</a> and included; <a href="Craddock%20Dufty">Craddock Dufty</a>, <a href="Roy%20Hardgrave">Roy Hardgrave</a>, <a href="Claude%20List">Claude List</a>, <a href="Len%20Scott">Len Scott</a>, <a href="Maurice%20Wetherill">Maurice Wetherill</a> (c), <a href="Stan%20Prentice">Stan Prentice</a>, <a href="Frank%20Delgrosso">Frank Delgrosso</a>, <a href="Lou%20Hutt">Lou Hutt</a>, <a href="Wally%20Somers">Wally Somers</a>, <a href="Andrew%20O%27Brien%20%28rugby%29">Jim O'Brien</a>, <a href="Tom%20Timms">Tom Timms</a>, <a href="Mick%20O%27Brien%20%28rugby%20league%29">Mick O'Brien</a>, <a href="Vern%20Goodall">Vern Goodall</a>, <a href="Hec%20Brisbane">Hec Brisbane</a>, <a href="Trevor%20Hall%20%28rugby%20league%29">Trevor Hall</a>, <a href="Alf%20Townsend">Alf Townsend</a>, <a href="Bert%20Eckhoff">Bert Eckhoff</a> and <a href="Tim%20Peckham">Tim Peckham</a>.
Auckland Province lost to Great Britain 14-9 after leading 9-8 while <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland City</a> lost 26-15. Auckland City included <a href="Craddock%20Dufty">Craddock Dufty</a>, <a href="Len%20Scott">Len Scott</a>, <a href="Claude%20List">Claude List</a>, <a href="Roy%20Hardgrave">Roy Hardgrave</a>, <a href="Maurice%20Wetherill">Maurice Wetherill</a>, <a href="Stan%20Prentice">Stan Prentice</a>, <a href="Frank%20Delgrosso">Frank Delgrosso</a>, <a href="Andrew%20O%27Brien%20%28rugby%29">Jim O'Brien</a>, <a href="Wally%20Somers">Wally Somers</a>, <a href="Lou%20Hutt">Lou Hutt</a>, <a href="Trevor%20Hall%20%28rugby%20league%29">Trevor Hall</a>, J Payne and <a href="Alan%20Clarke%20%28rugby%20league%29">Alan Clarke</a>. Auckland Province included <a href="Joe%20Menzies">Joe Menzies</a> from <a href="Waikato%20rugby%20league%20team">South Auckland</a> as well as Dufty, Scott, List, Beattie, W Hanlon, <a href="Jim%20Amos%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jim Amos</a>, Bill Peckham, <a href="Neville%20St%20George">Neville St George</a>, Dick Moisley, Hall, J Payne and R Jenkinson from Auckland City.
National competitions.
Northern Union Cup.
<a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> held the <a href="Northern%20Union%20Cup">Northern Union Cup</a> at the end of the season. Auckland won the trophy by defeating <a href="Waikato%20rugby%20league%20team">South Auckland</a> 22-3 in June before defeating <a href="Canterbury%20rugby%20league%20team">Canterbury</a> 66-26 in Auckland to defend the trophy.
Inter-district competition.
<a href="Otago%20rugby%20league%20team">Otago</a> traveled to Auckland in September, being defeated 42-22 at <a href="Carlaw%20Park">Carlaw Park</a>.
<a href="Jim%20Amos%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jim Amos</a>, <a href="Roy%20Hardgrave">Roy Hardgrave</a>, <a href="Craddock%20Dufty">Craddock Dufty</a>, <a href="Allan%20Seagar">Allan Seagar</a>, <a href="Hec%20Brisbane">Hec Brisbane</a>, <a href="Len%20Scott">Len Scott</a> and <a href="Claude%20List">Claude List</a> represented Auckland while Canterbury included <a href="Ted%20Spillane">Ted Spillane</a>. Otago included <a href="Bert%20Eckhoff">Bert Eckhoff</a>.
Club competitions.
Auckland.
Devonport won the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a>'s competition. <a href="Marist%20Saints">Marist</a> won the Roope Rooster, Stormont Shield and Labour Day Knockout Competitions. Grafton Athletic won the Norton Cup.
<a href="Jim%20Amos%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jim Amos</a> played for City.
<a href="Marist%20Saints">Marist</a> included <a href="Hec%20Brisbane">Hec Brisbane</a>, <a href="Jack%20Kirwan%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jack Kirwan</a>, <a href="Andrew%20O%27Brien%20%28rugby%29">Jim O'Brien</a>, <a href="Gordon%20Campbell%20%28rugby%20league%29">Gordon Campbell</a>, captain <a href="Charles%20Gregory%20%28rugby%20league%29">Charles Gregory</a> and <a href="Wilf%20Hassan">Wilf Hassan</a>.
Wellington.
Hutt won the <a href="Wellington%20Rugby%20League">Wellington Rugby League</a>'s Appleton Shield.
Canterbury.
Marist Old Boys won the <a href="Canterbury%20Rugby%20League">Canterbury Rugby League</a>'s McKeon Cup.
Marist Old Boys defeated Greymouth Marist 22-13 to win the <a href="Thacker%20Shield">Thacker Shield</a>.
Other Competitions.
The Hikurangi Rugby Club withdrew from the North Auckland <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> competition in 1928, helping to establish rugby league in Northland. The <a href="Northland%20rugby%20league%20team">Northland rugby league team</a> first played in 1929.
Marist Old Boys defeated the <a href="Otago%20Rugby%20League">Otago Rugby League</a>'s Christian Brothers 17-10 to win the Gore Cup.
